newsitem.title: USA: Ford denies glass unit is up for sale.
newsitem.headline: Ford denies glass unit is up for sale.

text.p: A Ford Motor Co spokesman on Friday denied a published report that the automaker is again trying to sell its glass division.
"There's no change in the status of the glass operations," said Ford spokesman Niel Golightly.
The Detroit News, citing unnamed company executives, reported Friday the automaker is once again shopping for buyers for the unprofitable business.

Ford has previously tried to sell the operations. The company took the glass unit off the sale block last year ahead of talks on a new labor contract after objections were raised from the United Auto Workers union.

Golightly said the glass division continues to be part of the ongoing review of the company's newly formed Automotive Products Operations, which is comprised of Ford's $14 billion automotive components businesses.
"We are concentrating on making it competitive and successful and folding it into the APO organization," he said.
The glass unit has a total of 4,500 workers, mostly in the U.S. It has six plants, four wholly owned facilities in the U.S., as well as joint ventures in China and Mexico.
